ratings.comment: This is for Endocrinology/Zoo 603. Professor Nashold's lectures are sometimes dense/tough, but this is a 600 level bio course so it's to be expected. She's very kind and willing to explain concepts after class, and my only critique is that she sometimes just reads off slides for lectures (the slides are good though). Very interesting content!
She is so kind and was willing to write me a letter of rec which I really appreciate. I loved her class and the tests were not that hard but there was a lot of content.

(This is for endo)
Each lecture is about 1-1.5 WEEKS worth of other biology-based courses here. Exam questions are sketchy, attendance is for points, and she basically just reads off slides. The lectures are denser than lead. It's impossible to memorize everything that's thrown at you. You never know what is actually important for the exam.
She only reads off of her power point. There is no homework to apply what you learn.

She's an OK teacher. To me, it didn't seem like she knew very much because she basically read off the slides and didn't add any information other than what was on the slides. Exams were tough! Overall, an OK professor

She enjoys teaching Biology and seems to have passion for it. However, her lectures are a bit boring, since she basically reads the slides. Her test are tough. A lot of the stuff on her test are things she covered in class for 30 seconds.

Profesor Nashold means well and is very kind. She tries to make the class enjoyable with occasional humor. Her tests are also very easy. The only reason I go to class though is because she takes attendance... All she does is read off of the slides (most of which she didn't even prepare herself). The lecture is very disjointed from the discussion.
